Entries.default: The roar of the crowd fades. A soft violet light grows before you, taking on definition as an aumaua soul materializes.
"I am proud! I have chosen you, Watcher! You and I are one!"
"And the chosen of the other Faces of the Hunt. I assume they are next?"
"That's it? I was hoping for more."
"Perhaps a moment of silence for the other contenders is in order."
"Next, the grand melee! Seeker, Slayer, Survivor, all chosen fight at once!"
"Worry not! More bloodshed always awaits!"
He laughs boisterously, then blinks at you in confusion.

"Win, and you will be crowned Champion of the Hunt. Die, and you will not win!"

He lets out another rolling peal of laughter.
"I'm ready for whatever's next."
"Is there some sort of power struggle between you and the other Faces of the Hunt?"
"How many more must die before the Crucible decides I'm worthy?"
"What if I fail to become champion?"
"Go! The crowd hungers for carnage! Do not fail them!"
"Of course! All is always struggle! If one isn't struggling, they are dead!"
"The killing would never end, if it were up to me, but the Crucible will sing to the Champion of the Hunt."
"Aside from disappointing Toamowhai, your ancestors, your lovers, and - worst of all - me?"
"The others are fools! They would serve forever! But soon they'll know!"
"And when you are crowned Champion of the Hunt, find me. We will have much to do!"
"You slaughter everything! Toamowhai must be proud!"
"You are serious?"
"If they were worth mourning, they would not have thrown themselves beneath your claws!"
"That is why Toamowhai guided you here!"
"And when you are Champion of the Hunt, you will have no end of brash cubs eager to claim your crown!"
"A lesser Champion of the Hunt will lack a Watcher's ears. They may hear the Crucible's song, but will not know what is said."
"The souls of this place will reveal themselves only to you!"
"They'll know the stelgaer for the strongest of Toamowhai's shapes!"
"Who were you, before you became the Slaying Face?"
"When my season was in bloom, no hunter stood a chance against me! But I had an advantage - a painful advantage."
"For I was awake to the memories of the last few seconds of every life I ever lived. And each one on this island!"
"Each misstep, each jab I should have seen coming, each life-ending failure! I learned from them, forged by battles waged before I drew breath!"
"Or at least the most enthusiastic."
"I didn't tell you before, but Galawain - the Lord of the Hunt - warned me away from this place."
The aumaua's face splits into a grin so wide it seems it might halve his head.
"You bring many glad tidings, brother slayer!"
Entries.female: "You bring many glad tidings, sister slayer!"

Entries.default: "When you've claimed the crown, the gods will see you for the threat you are!"
"How is it they'll know you for the strongest?"
"When you win! When you win of course!"
He laughs, the soul's scarred face twisting and flaring.
The spirit flickers as if in doubt. As if hiding something.
